title: cassieheart
author: cassieheart
content: I was looking through eBay and ran across what I think seems like a good deal on some older Baikal ASICS, I don't have much money to burn ATM and I'm kinda on a budget,these are Multi Algo, and will mine Blake256R14, Blake256R8, and Blake2B if I can win them at $300 would that be a good deal? I was looking at other comparable Baikal and Antminers they seem to be going for twice that price for one miner, but I don't know much about them and was hoping someone here had some experience with Baikal. https://www.ebay.com/itm/185579622973

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Check this data, if I remember correctly, these are old ASICs. The profit there is very small and there may be problems with the service and the availability. of spare parts.Baikal BK-B profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-bBaikal BK-D profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-d

comments.author: cassieheart
comments.body: Quote from: FP91G on September 14, 2022, 11:33:22 AMCheck this data, if I remember correctly, these are old ASICs. The profit there is very small and there may be problems with the service and the availability. of spare parts.Baikal BK-B profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-bBaikal BK-D profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-d Looks like they are not profitable atm, but that's at Lbry's current low prices I might see if I can win them, I have a feeling LBC is going to boom.Thank you for the links, that helped a lot.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: cassieheart on September 14, 2022, 09:37:52 PMQuote from: FP91G on September 14, 2022, 11:33:22 AMCheck this data, if I remember correctly, these are old ASICs. The profit there is very small and there may be problems with the service and the availability. of spare parts.Baikal BK-B profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-bBaikal BK-D profitability calculatorhttps://minerstat.com/hardware/baikal-d Looks like they are not profitable atm, but that's at Lbry's current low prices I might see if I can win them, I have a feeling LBC is going to boom.Thank you for the links, that helped a lot.Do not buy used ASICs.The only thing I would buy is the old Bitmain AntMiner S9-S15 ASICs, which are very inexpensive to repair and are repaired in most services. But you must have very cheap electricity, for example 1.5-2 cents.And if unpopular asics break down, you won’t be able to quickly repair it.
